title: I don't think I have ever seen anyone ever complain about getting banned for intentionally feeding
body:
Have any of you?

I mean I know people are getting muted, chat restrictions, bans, warnings for toxicity.

But I have never seen a post about someone try to complain about being banned for feeding.

Wonder what percentage of players actually get banned for this.

replies.body: I imagine its the obvious thing, if they took their 2/22/3 6 tear page in here, we'd all laugh at them and tell them they deserved it.  The ones who come in here are the ragers saying 'i only meant he should get a mild sort of cancer', and when I said 'F#$% your mother' I meant in a nice way.

I wouldn't imagine there would be that many who have that little common sense. I mean, I'm in mid-bronze and I only ever see an inter every 100 games usually. When I did my Flex placements, there was someone inting for literally the first 5 games, but it's really whatever.

Me? I think the punishment for inting should be a lot more severe. First a 2 week ban, then a permanent ban. No warning before your 2 week ban, the notification for the 2 week ban says that next time your account will be deleted.

That is generally how inting is treated.

I have seen a couple of posts by people asking why they were banned and people pointed to very bad games in their history. 90% sure they were banned for that but I never went back to check if they posted about their support tickets. 

They are few and far between mosly because they usually know why they were punished.

Well look at it this way
When you get banned/punished for toxicity you clearly can say you were not it. You are clearly pissed about it, as words can be read in so many ways. One way you're not toxic, One way you are Toxic

but intent feeding is a tad more understandable by a user
end a game 0/18/0 have 6 tears in a 25 min game, I mean yeah that is feeding no matter how hard you try to convince someone else.

Feeding is also harder to detect is my guess by riot, as bad games happen yada yada
So feeding cases are clear cut cases to all(or should be)
Toxicity cases: people think what they say isnt toxic so they argue their case, and usually are never happy 
so they come to the forums to rant about how its unfair, the bs system, etc
I have. It's always the people who somehow don't know that others have the capability of looking up their match history. And people who don't know that are pretty rare.
I have. Not a lot, but a few each month. I think two last week.

I have only ever seen 1 time and a Rioter even told him he did intentional feed but 99% I never see people who intentional feed get perma ban other then good old pal TylerFken1 since people posted videos on him on reddit and Riot doesn't want to look bad so they perma banned him. He also only got banned for toxic but never intentional feeding so I question this system Riot has.
